Key Match Events: Julian Álvarez scored the first goal for Argentina in the 23rd minute.
Lionel Messi scored the second goal for Argentina in the 51st minute.
Jonathan David received a yellow card in the 32nd minute.
Stephen Eustáquio received a yellow card in the 63rd minute.
Ismaël Koné received a yellow card in the 79th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Jesse Marsch chose to put Ismaël Koné back into midfield after his strong play in the quarter-final against Venezuela.
Argentina's coach Lionel Scaloni made changes to the team, including Gonzalo Montiel at right-back, Ángel Di María on the wing, and Julian Álvarez starting up top ahead of Lautaro Martínez.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's dream run at the Copa América ended with a 2-0 loss to Argentina in the semifinal.
Despite the loss, Canada showed a competitive spirit and forced Argentina to take them seriously.
Canada will play in the third place match against either Colombia or Uruguay.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina's goalkeeper Emiliano Martínez resorted to time-wasting tactics late in the match.
Canada's Tani Oluwaseyi had two close chances to score but was denied by Emiliano Martínez.
